meanings.definition: Used to indicate duty or obligation.
meanings.sent1: Children ought to listen to their parents.
meanings.sent2: You ought to finish your homework before playing.
meanings.sent3: I ought to clean my room, but I'd rather take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The student felt he ought to study harder to pass the test.
meanings.sent5: She knew she ought to apologize for her mistake.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate a desirable or expected state of affairs.
meanings.sent1: A good friend ought to be trustworthy.
meanings.sent2: This cake ought to be delicious with all those ingredients.
meanings.sent3: The sunny weather made for an ought day at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The new painting brought an ought touch to the room.
meanings.sent5: The garden looked like an ought paradise with all the flowers.
